thread.title: Bridgeton football climbs to .500, tops Lower Cape May
thread.title_full: Bridgeton football climbs to .500, tops Lower Cape May

title: Bridgeton football climbs to .500, tops Lower Cape May
text:
Bridgeton football climbs to .500, tops Lower Cape May ANTOINE SHELTON, SPECIAL TO THE DAILY JOURNAL 12:32 a.m. EDT October 17, 2015 Bridgeton football beats Lower Cape May (Photo: 33ft, Getty Images/iStockphoto) 3 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
LOWER CAPE MAY The Bridgeton High School football team's comeback tour continued on Friday night. 
The Bulldogs picked up their third straight victory with a 42-7 win over Lower Cape May, climbing to .500 for the first time this season. 
Bridgeton (3-3) gained 397 yards of offense, all of which came on the ground. 
Part of the reason the Bulldogs ran so much was because their starting quarterback, David Mosley, was out of the game due to a lower bicep injury on his throwing arm. The team rallied around each other and put on another dominating performance led by running backs Revell Williams and Basil Williams. 
Basil Williams got the scoring underway on his first carry of the game, breaking a 32-yard run and taking it to the end zone. 
He said his blockers paved the way for him en route to his 106-yard night. 
“Our line had a big part of it,” he said. “They had a great game tonight, and our fullback, he set the tone. He came out hitting the linebackers giving me the hole to run through.” 
With Mosley out for the game, the team used a next-man-up mentality. 
“Markquese stepped up at quarterback and other people had to step in and do their job," Revell Williams said. 
Revell Williams ripped off big runs of 81 and 33 yards, each going for touchdowns. He finished with 112 yards on three attempts. 
Not attempting a pass all night worked in the Bulldogs favor. 
Head coach Dave Ellen said simply, “If you don’t have to pass. You don’t.” 
The only miscues the Bulldogs faced were four penalties and one big special teams play by the Tigers. Running back Jake Robb nearly took a kickoff to the house, but was stopped short at the 6-yard line. It was only three plays later when fellow running back Carl Carlson ran the ball two yards for the only Tiger touchdown. 
The Bulldog defense was strong all night, allowing only 48 yards on the ground and six through the air. Bridgeton also forced a fumble, but didn’t recover it. 
The Bulldogs will look to get above .500 next week against Millville. 
“We have a big game next week,” Basil Williams said. “We have to keep doing what we’ve been doing and getting better as the week goes on.” 
Bridgeton 42, Lower Cape May 7 
Bridgeton (3-3) 14 20 8 0 - 42 
L, Cape May (1-4) 0 7 0 0 - 7 
Scoring 
B: B. Williams 32 run (run failed) 
B: D. Soloman 49 run (Bell run) 
B: R. Williams 81 run (Bell run) 
B: R. Williams 33 run (pass failed) 
LCM: C. Carlson 2 run (Favre kick) 
B: B. Williams 44 run (run failed) 
B: B. Williams 5 run (Bell pass)
